title: Chanson Père et Fils 2013  Gevrey-Chambertin
description: This wine is firm and structured, with complex tannins and dark black-fruit flavors. Under the tannins, juicy fruit with considerable acidity gives signs of great potential. The aftertaste again comes back to the structure. Drink from 2019.

title: Boedecker Cellars 2013 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: This appealing wine offers threads of pine needle, sage and parsley, augmenting a clean core of apple and white peach fruit. The complexity is compelling, and the length impressive, though it fades just a little too much to stand up to long term aging.

title: Di Meo 2003 Erminia De Meo  (Fiano di Avellino)
description: At an impressive 13-years-old, this deeply golden-hued wine opens with subtle aromas of toasted nut, pressed acacia flower and honey. The round, evolved palate still boasts freshness while the tertiary flavors include lemon zest, ginger, smoky mineral and a hint of marzipan.

title: Di Meo 2015 G  (Greco di Tufo)
description: This luminous white offers delicate scents suggesting crushed rock, pear and a whiff of botanical herb. The taut, vibrant palate recalls Granny Smith apple, nectarine and mineral set against a backbone of firm acidity.

title: Domaine Charles Baur 2013 Sylvaner (Alsace)
description: The nose is subdued but the palate shows the effortless, weightless charm of Sylvaner, with hints of green pear and lime as well as notes of stone and earth. It offers expressive slenderness.

title: Domaine Charles Frey 2013 Quintessence Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: The nose is secretive but the palate shows structure and poise. There is freshness and brisk, tart redcurrant fruit with some concentration, plesantly unexpected grip and lovely firmness. It's a light but impressive Pinot.

title: Viña Mayor 2012 Anzil  (Toro)
description: Grapy aromas seem simple at first, but with time tarry black plum and citrus peel notes emerge. This is very tannic, arguably a bit too much so. Plum, blackberry and chocolate flavors end with a reverb of hard tannins. For best results, give this as much air as possible.

title: W. Gisselbrecht 2015 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Bounteous fruit flavors need a little air to wake up but soon you'll have a party in your glass of ripe yellow plums, freshly cut apples, pears and melons. This is easy and very fruit-driven, balanced, light and just the ticket for a party in the sunshine.

title: Tenuta Rapitalà 2015 Grillo (Sicilia)
description: Subdued aromas of spring wild flower, hay and orchard fruit float from the glass. The vibrant palate offers lemon zest, sage, dried herb and a hint of saline framed in lively acidity.

title: Tenuta Rapitalà 2015 Rosato (Terre Siciliane)
description: Made with Nero d'Avola and Perricone, this offers alluring aromas of red berry, spice and a floral note. The bright, immediate palate offers succulent wild cherry, crushed raspberry nectarine zest and a hint of baking spice alongside zesty acidity that leads to a crisp, clean finish.

title: Sokol Blosser 2014 Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)
description: Whole-cluster pressed and barrel fermented, this is a deep gold, and opens powerfully with scents of buttered fruit and nuts. It's rich and creamy, showing toast and other barrel tones ahead of any specific fruit. Drink now through 2018.

title: Solitary Cellars 2012 East Block Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Like a well-made café latte, this wine balances the dry and restrained elements against creamy, mocha nuances that round out the texture and bring an almost sweet, jammy taste to the finish. Just substitute rich blackberry for coffee flavors to make the analogy work.

title: South Coast NV Brut Sparkling (Temecula Valley)
description: Bracingly effervescent bubbles offer aromas of baking soda, chalk and blood orange on this South Coast sparkler made from 82% Chardonnay and 18% Pinot Noir. The foamy palate offers inviting bubblegum and light cotton candy flavors, never sweet but very rounded and approachable in a crowd-pleasing way.

title: Château Fonfroide 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This is a fresh but also full and rich wine with ripe pear and raspberry fruits. The wine is balanced and ready to drink.

title: Villa Matilde 2015  Fiano di Avellino
description: Juicy and round, this opens with scents of honeysuckle, yellow stone fruit and a hint of aromatic herb. The full-bodied palate offers ripe white peach, pear and a hint of candied lemon drop while a mineral note backs up the finish.

title: Tenuta Rapitalà 2015 Vigna Casalj Catarratto (Alcamo)
description: Fragrant white flower and ripe orchard fruit aromas take center stage. The fresh palate offers mature yellow apple, pineapple, aromatic herb and a light toasted note while a hint of oak-driven spice accents the finish.

title: The Withers Winery 2013 Bel Canto Red (El Dorado)
description: This is a tasty, appetizing, classic Rhône-style blend that starts with savory, peppery aromas, fills in meaty sour-cherry flavors and has a lightly tannic texture and medium body. It's a good wine to stock at home, and will be versatile with food. Made from 73% Grenache, plus Mourvèdre and Syrah.

title: Kuentz-Bas 2013 Trois Chateaux Auxerrois (Alsace)
description: Full-fruited, expressive notes of ripe pear shine on nose and palate. This wine has lively, attractive fruit notes and bags of freshness and flavor. The palate is clean but has a soft, fresh richness at its core that makes it very moreish. Lemon notes linger beautifully.

title: Kuentz-Bas 2014 Trois Chateaux Auxerrois (Alsace)
description: A touch of earth is bound up with the ripe, juicy and tart pear flavors. This wine is slender and clean with lemon freshness. The concentrated palate focuses on that crisp, ripe lemon note.

title: Prospect 772 2013 Black Tie Charlie Red (California)
description: This wine is powerful enough to serve with wild boar carpaccio, if there is such a thing, or with blue cheese like a Port. The color is unusually dark and opaque, a stark black with a faintly purple rim. It smells spicy and tastes very concentrated, like blackberry jam, wood smoke and black pepper. The texture is almost thick and drenched with fine tannins while the body is quite full as well.

title: Pietradolce 2015 Bianco  (Etna)
description: Aromas recalling hay, yellow flower, dried herb and a light vegetal note carry over to the bright, medium-bodied palate along with lime and green apple. A flinty mineral note underscores the vibrant flavors.

title: Tonnino 2014 Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)
description: Aromas of blue flower, black-skinned fruit and a whiff of Mediterranean scrub meld in the glass. The chewy, straightforward palate doles out juicy black cherry and ground pepper. It's made to drink young so enjoy soon.

title: San Simeon 2014 Mourvèdre (Paso Robles)
description: Deep cola, blackberry, blueberry pie, vanilla ice cream, soft caramel and root beer float aromas show on the nose of this juicy, easy-to-enjoy bottling. It's jammy with blueberry and black cherry, followed by rich caramel, chocolate, a touch of anise and vanilla long into the finish.

title: Zaca Mesa 2014 McGinley Vineyard Homage Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Pear and nectarine flesh are cut by a quince, Gala apple and slightest touches of guava and mango on the chalky nose of this wine. It's refreshingly light on the palate, with sliced pear and squeezed lime notes, bound by a very grippy texture.

title: V. Sattui 2013 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This is a fully oaken, reserve-level wine with decadent yellow wax that's concentrated and ripe on the palate in toffee, vanilla and baked apple pie. Robust, it drinks decadently.

title: William Church 2013 Bishop's Red (Columbia Valley (OR))
description: This wine is just over half Cabernet Sauvignon (55%), with the rest Merlot (20%), Malbec (15%) and Petit Verdot. Aromas of dark cherry meats, plum, herb and spice are followed by elegant fruit flavors backed by a firm grip of lightly dry tannins.

title: 3 Rings 2014 Shiraz (Barossa Valley)
description: Notes of wild herbs bring added interest to this wine's cherry fruit. It's medium-full in size and weight, with supple tannins and a long, minty finish. It's big and ripe enough to be served on its own, yet should also work with lamb or beef.

title: Allimant-Laugner 2014 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Soft apple notes on nose and palate make for a subtle, soft but fresh wine. The fruitiness is there but not in the foreground, just coloring this friendly, lightly textured wine with flavor. Drink soon; it will be at its best with equally subtle food or soft cheeses.

title: Colliano 2013 Cuvée White (Goriska Brda)
description: This blend of 40% Ribolla Gialla, 30% Chardonnay and 30% Sauvignonasse has aromas of freshly cut grass, lemon grass and white peach. It is clean and bright in the mouth with flavors of peach, apple, pear and apricot.

title: Concha y Toro 2015 Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)
description: Punchy citrus and minerally aromas open this fresh SB. A juicy, citric palate points in the right direction, while this tastes like tangerine and orange peel mixed with lime and green herbs. A crisp, persistent finish closes it out.
